result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Moen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$150 cash bond to be applied towards Court costs.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no contact with Julie L. or Dustin J.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard A Moen in court with attorney Kenneth L. Jost.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 16CF193 & 15CM509
State relates agreement. Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the Court. J.L. provides victim statement. 

16CF193 - State moves to amend to two counts pursuant to 940.315 (1)(a) a class A misdemeanor. Court grants amendment and addition of count 2. Defendant pleads guilty to both counts. Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. 

Court relates and orders on counts 1 & 2
Sentence withheld - 2 years probation concurrent with 15CM509.
Must have no contact with Julie Link or Dustin Johnson.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Costs   

15CM509 - State moves to dismiss and read-in count 1. Court grants. 
Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 

Court relates and orders: 
Sentence withheld - 2 years probation. 
Must have no contact with Julie Link or Dustin Johnson.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Costs
